original_theorem:
If $\{F_n\}$ converges uniformly to $F$ on $S$ and each $F_n$ is
continuous on $S,$ then so is $F;$ that is$,$ a uniform limit of
continuous functions is continuous.
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem uniform_limit_of_continuous_functions_is_continuous
    {Œ± Œ≤ : Type*} [TopologicalSpace Œ±] [UniformSpace Œ≤]
    {F : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {s : Set Œ±}
    (h_unif : TendstoUniformlyOn F f atTop s)
    (h_cont : ‚àÄ n, ContinuousOn (F n) s) :
    ContinuousOn f s := by
```

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem uniform_limit_of_continuous_functions_is_continuous
    {Œ± Œ≤ : Type*} [TopologicalSpace Œ±] [UniformSpace Œ≤]
    {F : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {s : Set Œ±}
    (h_unif : TendstoUniformlyOn F f atTop s)
    (h_cont : ‚àÄ n, ContinuousOn (F n) s) :
    ContinuousOn f s := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
‚Ä¢ {$F_n$} is a sequence of functions on S converging uniformly to F [tc_1]
‚Ä¢ Each $F_n$ is continuous on S, which implies integrability on compact subsets [tc_2]
‚Ä¢ $[a, b]$ is a closed real interval such that $[a, b] ‚äÜ S$ [def_1]
‚Ä¢ The supremum norm on S is $||g||_S = \sup_{x‚ààS} |g(x)|$ [def_2]
Therefore, we conclude:
‚Ä¢ For each n, $|\int_a^b F_n(x)\,dx - \int_a^b F(x)\,dx| \le (b-a)\|F_n-F\|_S$ [l1].
